When an author, copyeditor or editor uploads a new version (odt, doc, docx, or pdf format) of an article, this module submits it to the document markup server specified in the configuration file, and receives a zipped file containing pdf, xml, and html versions of the article, as well as bibliography information automatically styled per the journal's guidelines. This zipped file is kept in the supplementary files folder for inspection during the review process. When ready to publish the article, the pdf, xml, and html galley files are extracted and made available from the journal table of contents.
Unable to fetch article xml and html versions. The Document Markup plugin needs to be enabled and the citation style needs to be provided in Journal Settings.
Type part of an organization or publication name to lookup the citation style from the local CSL database. Our database is updated regularly from its http://citationstyles.org/styles/ source.
The journal will retrieve converted documents from this server URL. Normally you should not change this setting.

This plugin can use either a guest account (limited to 10 conversions per week) or an unlimited use account. Leave the User ID field blank for guest account use. For more information, visit PKP Document Markup Service.
Select this if you want a separate document-review.pdf version prepared for reviewers. It is stripped of author information and is available in the "Document Markup Files" supplementary file archive.
PHP Curl needs to be installed on your OJS server. This plugin uses curl to send and receive the article files to the Document Markup Server service for processing.
PHP zlib needs to be installed on your OJS server. This plugin uses zlib to unzip the Document Markup Server files.
This plugin has only been tested with php 5.x, so earlier versions may not work.

"Enabled" is the preferred and common selection. It means OJS pages and documents are accessed as folder paths in URLs. "Disabled" means OJS uses URL parameters to access pages and documents. Currently a limitation with the disabled mode is that viewing (View Proof link) HTML galley files generated by the plugin might not display some prepared media.

These HTML stylesheets control the display of articles when presented by this plugin. Default files are automatically created. You may replace these with your own customized versions using the file manager

When this plugin displays an article, it can have a png or jpg header image at top of first page that shows the journal branding. Upload this header image here. The image should be a maximum of 800px wide and 100px tall. To remove it, use the file manager
